gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.18/hr reflects persistent supply constraints and elevated capex requirements as NVIDIA's production capacity struggles to match surging AI compute demand, creating a favorable environment for alternative chip architectures.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.25/1M signals intensifying API price compression driven by model efficiency improvements and aggressive competition, forcing providers to optimize inference costs while maintaining quality differentiation.

gagl.text: Annual load of 120 TWh indicates substantial grid strain from AI infrastructure expansion, necessitating accelerated nuclear and renewable deployment to maintain grid stability while meeting aggressive decarbonization targets.

aipi.text: Converging hardware scarcity, API price deflation, and energy intensity suggest an industry inflection point where sustainable growth models must balance rapid deployment with operational efficiency to prevent bubble formation.
